main event: An observation of an unidentified object described as 'like a light, changing brightness, 1/2th the size of a star' occurred on January 17, 1962.
interesting points: The object was observed swaying from the northwest to overhead and northward slowly.,The sighting lasted approximately 3-5 minutes.,The witness described the object as brilliant.,The case is classified as insufficient information, but is probably a balloon.,The sighting was made in Lynn, Massachusetts.
witness description: observer identified the object as a familiar object, such as a star, planet or balloon.
